com.intel.icecp.core.attributes

Class WriteableBaseAttribute<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.icecp.core.attributes.BaseAttribute<T>
      • com.intel.icecp.core.attributes.WriteableBaseAttribute<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the value stored in this attribute; beware of using nested generics here
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Attribute<T>, WriteableAttribute<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IdAttribute, NameAttribute

    public abstract class WriteableBaseAttribute<T>
extends BaseAttribute<T>
implements WriteableAttribute<T>
    Extension for the base attribute to allow simple reading and writing; note that if the value stored is a reference this class will return that reference, making the inner data modifiable across multiple users (if this is an issue consider cloning value and returning the clone).

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T value()
      Note that returning a reference to an object held inside the attribute implementation means that external users can modify inside the implementation; to avoid this, attribute implementations should return new instances of the returned value, e.g.

      Set the value of the attribute

    • Method Detail

      • value

        public T value()
        Description copied from interface: Attribute
        Note that returning a reference to an object held inside the attribute implementation means that external users can modify inside the implementation; to avoid this, attribute implementations should return new instances of the returned value, e.g. return new String(value). Alternatively, implementations can implement a form of cloning in order to protect the original reference. Most applications, however, will likely return the (new) result of some calculation and this should not be an issue.
        Specified by:
        value in interface Attribute<T>
        Specified by:
        value in class BaseAttribute<T>
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute at the current time

      • value

        public void value(T newValue)
        Description copied from interface: WriteableAttribute
        Set the value of the attribute
        Specified by:
        value in interface WriteableAttribute<T>
        Parameters:
        newValue - the new value
